Available since version2.0
Source Code
Widget is the base class for widgets.

Hide inherited properties

Property Details

$counter property
integer $counter = 0

A counter used to generate $id for widgets.

$autoIdPrefix property
string $autoIdPrefix = 'w'

The prefix to the automatically generated widget IDs.

See Also

$stack property
yii\base\Widget[] $stack = []

The widgets that are currently being rendered (not ended). This property is maintained by begin() and end() methods.

list of behaviors attached to this component

Method Details

begin() method
static begin( $config = [] )
$config array Name-value pairs that will be used to initialize the object properties
return static the newly created widget instance

Begins a widget.

This method creates an instance of the calling class. It will apply the configuration to the created instance. A matching end() call should be called later.

end() method
static end( )
return static the widget instance that is ended.
throws yii\base\InvalidCallException if begin() and end() calls are not properly nested

Ends a widget.

Note that the rendering result of the widget is directly echoed out.

widget() method
string widget( $config = [] )
$config array Name-value pairs that will be used to initialize the object properties
return string the rendering result of the widget.

Creates a widget instance and runs it.

The widget rendering result is returned by this method.

getId() method
string getId( $autoGenerate = true )
$autoGenerate boolean Whether to generate an ID if it is not set previously
return string ID of the widget.

Returns the ID of the widget.

setId() method
void setId( $value )
$value string Id of the widget.

Sets the ID of the widget.

getView() method
yii\web\View getView( )
return yii\web\View the view object that can be used to render views or view files.

Returns the view object that can be used to render views or view files.

The render() and renderFile() methods will use this view object to implement the actual view rendering. If not set, it will default to the "view" application component.

setView() method
void setView( $view )
$view yii\base\View The view object that can be used to render views or view files.

Sets the view object to be used by this widget.

run() method
void run( )

Executes the widget.

render() method
string render( $view, $params = [] )
$view string The view name. Please refer to findViewFile() on how to specify a view name.
$params array The parameters (name-value pairs) that should be made available in the view.
return string the rendering result.
throws yii\base\InvalidParamException if the view file does not exist.

Renders a view.

The view to be rendered can be specified in one of the following formats:

  • path alias (e.g. "@app/views/site/index");
  • absolute path within application (e.g. "//site/index"): the view name starts with double slashes. The actual view file will be looked for under the view path of the application.
  • absolute path within module (e.g. "/site/index"): the view name starts with a single slash. The actual view file will be looked for under the view path of the currently active module.
  • relative path (e.g. "index"): the actual view file will be looked for under $viewPath.

If the view name does not contain a file extension, it will use the default one .php.

renderFile() method
string renderFile( $file, $params = [] )
$file string The view file to be rendered. This can be either a file path or a path alias.
$params array The parameters (name-value pairs) that should be made available in the view.
return string the rendering result.
throws yii\base\InvalidParamException if the view file does not exist.

Renders a view file.

getViewPath() method
string getViewPath( )
return string the directory containing the view files for this widget.

Returns the directory containing the view files for this widget.

The default implementation returns the 'views' subdirectory under the directory containing the widget class file.

findViewFile() method
string findViewFile( $view )
$view string The view name.
return string the view file path. Note that the file may not exist.

Finds the view file based on the given view name.

File will be searched under $viewPath directory.
